noun.description: Any of a class of rock-forming silicate or aluminosilicate minerals typically occurring as fibrous or columnar crystals.
examples: acid rocks consist mostly of quartz and feldspars, with a little mica or amphibole

origin: Early 19th century: from French, from Latin amphibolus ambiguous (because of the varied structure of these minerals), from Greek amphibolos, from amphi- both, on both sides + ballein to throw.
